agave
Class AgaveFilter

java.lang.Object
  agave.AgaveFilter
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.servlet.Filter
public class AgaveFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.servlet.Filter

Scans the classes directory of a deployed context for any configured handlers and forwards HTTP requests to the handlers if they match the requested URI.

Author:
Damian Carrillo

init

public void init(javax.servlet.FilterConfig config)
          throws javax.servlet.ServletException
Initializes the AgaveFilter by scanning for handler classes and populating a HandlerRegistry with them. Then, this initializes the dependency injection container (if any) by instantiation a ClassEnvironment.

Specified by:
init in interface javax.servlet.Filter
Parameters:
config - the supplied filter configuration object

doFilter

public final void doFilter(javax.servlet.ServletRequest req,
                           javax.servlet.ServletResponse resp,
                           javax.servlet.FilterChain chain)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           javax.servlet.ServletException

Handles the routing of HTTP requests through the framework. The algorithm used internally is as follows:

  1. Instantiate a form if necessary
    1. Bind request parameters if necessary
    2. Bind URI parameters if necessary
  2. Instantiate a handler
  3. Bind the request to the handler if necessary
  4. Bind the response to the handler if necessary
  5. Invoke the handler method with the instantiated form as the only argument

When one of the two supported encoding methods is selected, then this filter will field the HTTP request that was made and will prevent future execution of the filter chain. If an unsupported encoding type is requested or if a handler is not configured for the requested URI, this filter will simply continue with execution of the filter chain. The two encoding types that are supported by this method are:

  • application/x-www-form-urlencoded
  • multipart/form-data

Specified by:
doFilter in interface javax.servlet.Filter
Parameters:
req - the Servlet request object; it will be cast to an HttpServletRequest
resp - the Servlet response object; it will be cast to an HttpServletResponse
chain - the filter chain this filter is a member of
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
javax.servlet.ServletException - if a Servlet error occurs
See Also:
W3C Form Encoding Types, HandlesRequestsTo, BindsParameter, ConvertWith, BindsRequest, BindsResponse

scanClassesDirForHandlers

protected void scanClassesDirForHandlers(java.io.File root)
                                  throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                         java.io.IOException,
                                         java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Scans the supplied directory for handlers. Handlers in turn are inspected and have a HandlerDescriptor generated for them which then gets registered in the HandlerRegistry as handlers are found.

Parameters:
root - the root directory to scan files for, typically /WEB-INF/classes
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException
java.io.IOException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
